channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Blocked drains, 16th February
item.description:
Several blocked drains along this road, this is one example. Water filled and not draining despite no rain for last 24 hours. Some are completely blocked up with leaves etc.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shelburne Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain cover making awful noise as traffic goes over it, 16th February
item.description:
On A46 leaving Cheltenham on Shurdington side of entrance to 103 Shurdington road. This has been previously repaired for the same fault as can be seen from the photograph.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 103, Shurdington Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Small but deep pothole just before Brookfield Lane turn, 16th February
item.description:
Pass Chosen Hill school and just before Brookfield Lane, the pothole is in the middle of the lane. I hit it at around 15mph in the dark and jarred my wrists and back.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brookfield Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole on main road, heading towards the church., 16th February
item.description:
Pothole is passed the Churchdown club fencing, the next house along at the end of this houses driveway- big pothole ! Heading towards the Church.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Sinkhole Under Pavement, 16th February
item.description:
Outside 1 Blacksmith Lane, Churchdown The fault Web Reference: 5563442 Enquiry Number: 22040347 Issue: Pothole on the Pavement Which has been reported as repaired has not been repaired. The pavement is still collapsing. I'd say it's about 30cm deep at the moment.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Blacksmith Lane, Churchdown, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Previously fix pot hole crumbling, 16th February
item.description:
This was fixed some months ago and is now a pot hole again. It is clear and obvious that the repair work is not fit for purpose or to standard if it only lasts months at a time. Interesting also just around the corner a previous pot hole fixed only weeks ago has degraded into another pot hole (this has been reported) this isn’t by chance it’s common sense that the repair work wasn’t carried out properly. Pot hole repairs should not last months or weeks if done right!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

The drain outside number 1 Tivoli Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Tivoli Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 16th February

item.title: Very dangerous series of potholes in Priors Road, 16th February
item.description:
From Sainsbury's north to B4632 there are a series of deep potholes. Busy traffic swerves to avoid them and results in many near collisions. This is the worst set of potholes I have seen and I am writing to the MP, with photos.The last repair here was highly substandard and reflects very poorly on the council. If my wheels/tyres are damaged I will claim.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 263, Priors Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 16th February
item.description:
Large pothole 100mm deep 1 metre long and 300mm wide, in the centre of the c/way and is a hazard to cyclists and road users.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2x Manholes suffering from subsidence & damage, 16th February
item.description:
2x manhole covers that have sunk due to subsidence & have caused damaged to passing vehicles (hub caps left at side of road). To avoid the damaged Triangular manholes, vehicles move to center of road which both are on slight bends, oncoming traffic just passes 40mph sign so may not slow to 30 quickly enough. What Three Words location - ///starters.recur.belonged

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Road, Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes all over the roads, 16th February
item.description:
There are multiple pothole all over Gloucester Road from the train station up to St Georges Road. I live on Gloucester road so I have to go through this road at least 3-4 times a day. The road is awful, it really needs some care to get up to standards. My car gets absolutely ruined driving all over those potholes. You also cannot avoid them as you could crash into other cars coming from the opposite way. Please look into repairing this road as soon as possible. This issue has been reported multiple times by the residents in this area and nothing has been done about it so far.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 206, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Badly finished not easy to navigate, 16th February
item.description:
Footpath from Hunters Road to Stoke Road . Used to have a step but now a slope,, dangerous for old people to navigate. The trees were cut down last year but the footpath hasn’t been dealt with. I was in contact with someone called Nicky but she hasn’t been responding. Please make it more accessible. I lead a walking group for the elderly and we C are unable to use this path.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12A,14,15,16, Hunters Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
